page.title: 12Trade; Shopping in Nailsea
page.content: The old{High Street}in Nailsea, which developed close to the old glass workers' cottages (which ceased to exist many years ago) used to be the main shopping centre until the mid 1950s. Since then the purpose-built pedestrian{shopping centre}with its supermarkets, shops, banks, offices, library and clinic has become the "heart" of Nailsea as far as trade is concerned. The very wide pedestrian area of Somerset Square sometimes serves as a place of outdoor entertainment with local school music groups or other organisations playing to passers-by. Three large car parks serve the centre. These have{free {parking}for customers' cars; an attraction not to be found in Bristol! However, many Nailsea people regularly travel to Weston-super-mare or to N.W. Bristol to shop at the{Hypermarkets.
